trans-unit.source: Manage a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Manage a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Links to resources for managing a web app in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Links to resources for managing a web app in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Manage a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Manage a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This topic contains links to resources for managing a web app in <link><linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This topic contains links to resources for managing a web app in <link><linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Management includes all of the tasks that keep your web app running smoothly.
trans-unit.target: Management includes all of the tasks that keep your web app running smoothly.

trans-unit.source: Over the lifetime of a web app, you will perform different management tasks, as you move from initial deployment to normal operation, maintenance, and updates.
trans-unit.target: Over the lifetime of a web app, you will perform different management tasks, as you move from initial deployment to normal operation, maintenance, and updates.

trans-unit.source: Many web app management tasks can be performed in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Many web app management tasks can be performed in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy your web app to production
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy your web app to production

trans-unit.source: Choose a tier
trans-unit.target: Choose a tier

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service is offered in five tiers: Free, Shared, Basic, Standard, and Premium.
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service is offered in five tiers: Free, Shared, Basic, Standard, and Premium.

trans-unit.source: For information about the features and pricing for each tier, see <link><linkText>Pricing details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the features and pricing for each tier, see <link><linkText>Pricing details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>App Service plans</linkText><title></title></link> let you group multiple web apps under the same tier.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>App Service plans</linkText><title></title></link> let you group multiple web apps under the same tier.

trans-unit.source: You can always <link><linkText>switch tiers</linkText><title></title></link> after you create your web app.
trans-unit.target: You can always <link><linkText>switch tiers</linkText><title></title></link> after you create your web app.

trans-unit.source: Configuration
trans-unit.target: Configuration

trans-unit.source: Use the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> to set various configuration options.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> to set various configuration options.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Configure web apps in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Configure web apps in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Here is a quick checklist:
trans-unit.target: Here is a quick checklist:

trans-unit.source: Select runtime versions for .NET, PHP, Java, or Python, if needed.
trans-unit.target: Select runtime versions for .NET, PHP, Java, or Python, if needed.

trans-unit.source: Enable WebSockets if your web app uses the WebSocket protocol.
trans-unit.target: Enable WebSockets if your web app uses the WebSocket protocol.

trans-unit.source: (This includes apps that use <link><linkText>ASP.NET SignalR</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>socket.io</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: (This includes apps that use <link><linkText>ASP.NET SignalR</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>socket.io</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Are you running continuous web jobs?
trans-unit.target: Are you running continuous web jobs?

trans-unit.source: If so, enable Always On.
trans-unit.target: If so, enable Always On.

trans-unit.source: Set the default document, such as index.html.
trans-unit.target: Set the default document, such as index.html.

trans-unit.source: In addition to these basic configuration settings, you may want to configure the following:
trans-unit.target: In addition to these basic configuration settings, you may want to configure the following:

trans-unit.source: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) encryption.
trans-unit.target: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) encryption.

trans-unit.source: To use SSL with a custom domain name, you must get an SSL certificate and configure your web app to use it.
trans-unit.target: To use SSL with a custom domain name, you must get an SSL certificate and configure your web app to use it.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Enable HTTPS for a web app in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Enable HTTPS for a web app in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Custom domain name. Your web app automatically has a subdomain under azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: Custom domain name. Your web app automatically has a subdomain under azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: You can associate a custom domain name, such as contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: You can associate a custom domain name, such as contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Language-specific configuration:
trans-unit.target: Language-specific configuration:

trans-unit.source: PHP: Configure PHP in Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: PHP: Configure PHP in Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Python: Configuring Python with Azure App Service Web Apps
trans-unit.target: Python: Configuring Python with Azure App Service Web Apps

trans-unit.source: While your web app is running
trans-unit.target: While your web app is running

trans-unit.source: While your web app is running, you want to make sure it is available, and that it scales to meet user traffic.
trans-unit.target: While your web app is running, you want to make sure it is available, and that it scales to meet user traffic.

trans-unit.source: You may also need to troubleshoot errors.
trans-unit.target: You may also need to troubleshoot errors.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Monitoring

trans-unit.source: Through the Azure preview portal, you can <link><linkText>add performance metrics</linkText><title></title></link> such as CPU usage and number of client requests.
trans-unit.target: Through the Azure preview portal, you can <link><linkText>add performance metrics</linkText><title></title></link> such as CPU usage and number of client requests.

trans-unit.source: For deeper insight, use New Relic to monitor and manage performance.
trans-unit.target: For deeper insight, use New Relic to monitor and manage performance.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>.NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>.NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Scale your web app</linkText><title></title></link> in response to traffic.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Scale your web app</linkText><title></title></link> in response to traffic.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your tier, you can scale the number of VMs and/or the size of the VM instances.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your tier, you can scale the number of VMs and/or the size of the VM instances.

trans-unit.source: In the Standard and Premium tiers, you can also set up autoscaling, so your web app scales automatically, either on a fixed schedule, or in response to load.
trans-unit.target: In the Standard and Premium tiers, you can also set up autoscaling, so your web app scales automatically, either on a fixed schedule, or in response to load.

trans-unit.source: Backups
trans-unit.target: Backups

trans-unit.source: Set <link><linkText>automatic backups</linkText><title></title></link> of your web app.
trans-unit.target: Set <link><linkText>automatic backups</linkText><title></title></link> of your web app.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about backups in <link><linkText>this video</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about backups in <link><linkText>this video</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Learn about the options for <link><linkText>database recovery</linkText><title></title></link> in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the options for <link><linkText>database recovery</linkText><title></title></link> in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: If something goes wrong, you can <link><linkText>troubleshoot in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title></link>, using diagnostic logs and live debugging in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: If something goes wrong, you can <link><linkText>troubleshoot in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title></link>, using diagnostic logs and live debugging in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Outside of Visual Studio, there are various ways to collect diagnostic logs.
trans-unit.target: Outside of Visual Studio, there are various ways to collect diagnostic logs.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Enable diagnostics logging for web apps in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Enable diagnostics logging for web apps in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For Node.js applications, see <link><linkText>How to debug a Node.js web app in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For Node.js applications, see <link><linkText>How to debug a Node.js web app in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Restoring Data
trans-unit.target: Restoring Data

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Restore</linkText><title></title></link> a web app that was previously backed up.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Restore</linkText><title></title></link> a web app that was previously backed up.

trans-unit.source: When you update your web app
trans-unit.target: When you update your web app

trans-unit.source: If you have not enabled automatic backups, you can create a <link><linkText>manual backup</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not enabled automatic backups, you can create a <link><linkText>manual backup</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Consider using <link><linkText>staged deployment</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Consider using <link><linkText>staged deployment</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This option lets you publish updates to a staging deployment that runs side-by-side with your production deployment.
trans-unit.target: This option lets you publish updates to a staging deployment that runs side-by-side with your production deployment.

trans-unit.source: If you use Visual Studio Online, you can set up continuous deployment from source control:
trans-unit.target: If you use Visual Studio Online, you can set up continuous deployment from source control:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Using Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Using Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Using Git</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Using Git</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
